about_the_game:
The demo version of Molytropia: Dead Stars Still Shine Here is an episode with a separate subtitle: "Like in That Movie, But Completely Different". It is both a part of the main story and a standalone, finished narrative.

The story is told from the perspective of a young man who accidentally meets a paralyzed girl in a video rental store. Over time, their acquaintance blossoms into a friendship filled with lighthearted and amusing, yet sometimes melancholic and wistful conversations.

Immerse yourself in the atmosphere of a warm summer day, where time seems to stand still, allowing the characters, and you along with them, to experience the fragile magic of moments that can change a destiny.

Gameplay:

Just like in most visual novels: read, click the mouse or press a key, then read again. And so on in a loop.

Key Features:

  • A warm, cozy atmosphere with a bittersweet touch.

  • Short playtime — around 40 minutes.

  • A pleasant soundtrack and stylized artwork.

  • The entire story unfolds within a single room.
